pageContext.description:
In an outdoor setting on Mt. Ida, tree to L., promontory with castle and mountain beyond, Paris in armor, half reclining at lower L., head on R. hand, helmet on ground in corner, Hermes in armor, bending over him, L. hand on tall staff, head of horse seen above bushes beyond, Aphrodite, Hera, Athena standing at R., nude, wearing necklaces, gossamer sheer scarves over the first and third. 
[Seattle Art Museum, revised 2013]

[Seattle Art Museum, revised 2012]

New York, 1948
Seattle, 1952
Osaka, Japan, 1970
Various installations from the museum's permanent collection, 1952-present
pageContext.markings:
Reverse of the panel:
Six circular stamps / seals:
- Czech customs stamp with lion inside of inscription, 'CELNÍ [ÚR]AD PRAHA' (customs office Prague)
- two German customs stamps with outlined cross beneath inscription, 'ZOLL / I-54' (tax or toll)
- two German customs stamps with eagle inside of inscription, 'Zollabfertigungsstelle [N]ieder[l]age - BERLIN' (customs processing site Berlin)'

Five paper labels:
- '18'
- [illegible - two lines, top might be a number]
- 'Lucas Cranach'
- '266 Cranach'
- 'No. 20465 / Lukas Cranach / Parisurteil / 63,3:41 [illegible]'

Four marks directly on wood:
- '31' or '3i'
- '7/8/ 'or '718/' in white
- '540' in red
- '39-31'

[Seattle Art Museum, revised 2013]

- (Possibly in Tillman[n] Collection, Amsterdam, before 1948)
- Le Roy M. Backus Collection, New York and Seattle, by 1948 until 1952
- Seattle Art Museum, Seattle, accessioned January 3, 1952
[Seattle Art Museum, revised 2013]
